alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Jackson; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT/715 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Gadsden and Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun and Jackson. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT /715 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM CDT /519 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge, Sycamore, Rosedale, Hardin Heights, River Junction, Roy, Hardaway, Juniper, Mount Pleasant and Sawdust. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
